COMMENT_TX: Caromed off Aldridge's shins and skidded past Friberg close to the stand.
Wonderful stop of hard smash; Flack remained at 3B. During the AB, Hornsby hit one completely out of the ball park, but was foul.

$A terrific storm swept through the park at this time
$Rain fell so heavily that play was stopped for 15 minutes
ej,mckeb101,M,klemn901,Call at home $Mueller missed a hard attempt to catch the ball.  Close play at the plate.  Mgr McKechnie and Barnhart protested Ump Klem's decision and McKechnie was ejected.

$During this AB, Grimm tried to make a 1-handed catch near the stands but crashed into the concrete wall near the Pittsburgh dugout and appeared to be badly hurt.  Time was called but he refused to quit and limped back to his position.
Too hot for Hornsby; off his glove
Dyer hurt his hand deflecting the smash to Hornsby
The two local papers cite Klem as home-plate ump, but NY Times and Chicago Daily Tribune claimed Wilson.

Great stop but wide throw to 2B

IPHR; Youngs & Southworth waited for each other to field it
Great play by Snyder who covered 3B

$During Youngs' AB, Ump Powell warned the NY bench to be quiet.  When the verbal assault continued, he ejected several Giant players.

During Sherdel's AB, Ump Sweeney was knocked down by a foul ball which apparently struck his left kneecap.  It was the 3rd or 4th time he had been hit.  He was groggy when he got to his feet and wanted to continue but was forced to leave the game.  3B umpire Quigley replaced him.
Grounder deflected off Traynor's foot to Maranville. Hornsby overslid 3B.
Guessing assists ('the entire Cardinal infield participated' in the run down).  Hornsby's throw hit Bigbee in the head.
Fine throw by Smith held Bigbee who was tagged out when Moore advanced to 3B while Bigbee retreated.
Clever play; Wright knocked it down and rolled it to 2B with his glove.
